lines.text: [Jones' "Anti Dive Bomber Gun" has set a barn alight]
One thing, Jones. I don't think you should have added the bicarbonate of soda.
[three Luftwaffe airmen are holding several people hostage in the Church Hall, when the platoon enter disguised as a choir, singing "All Things Bright and Beautiful"]
Frazer, get behind him.
And I will get his gun.
And I will take my bayonet, and stick it up his...
Halt!

[leaning close to Mainwaring]
I think they've rumbled us.
[Mainwaring has pulled out his revolver]
If you don't put that gun down, I will shoot you!
And if you don't put that gun down, I will shoot you!
I give you one last warning!
And I give you one last warning!
One!
One!
Two!
Two!
Three!
Three! If you shoot me, there are seven men to take my place!
Did you know that German's gun was empty, sir?
As a matter of fact, Wilson, so was mine!
We have an invaluable weapon in our army, ingenuity and improvisation.
That's two.
What's that supposed to be?
You said if we hadn't got anything else, tie a carving knife to a broomstick.
I didn't mean that you were to leave the broom at the end of the handle you stupid boy.
Damn bank clerk.
I happen to be the manager!
Well of course you are sir.
I could have sworn that they would never break through the Maginot line.
Quite right sir, they didn't.
I thought now. I'm a pretty good judge of these matters you know Wilson.
They went round the side.
I see... they what!
They went round the side.
That's a typical shabby Nazi trick, you see the sort of people we're up against Wilson.
Most unreliable sir.
You know what they say, where there's crowds, there's business.
Just a minute Wilson. I intend to mould those men out there into an aggressive fighting force and I'm not going to get very far if you keep inviting them to "step this way" in that nancy voice.
Wilson, find something for Jones to do will you.
Yes, alright sir, just leave it to me. Jones, would you mind please just going outside and lining the men up and just doing things with them.
He's got a gun.
Yes I know, I can see that sir, yes.
Well, I'm the officer.
Well of course you are sir, yes.
I should have that.
Why does he call you uncle?
Well you see, I've known his mother for a number of years, she's a widow and she has my ration book and I go round to her house sometimes for meals... and that sort of thing.
What sort of thing?
Well... um... sort of... other...
Frank, where have you been, you know your tea's been in the oven for over an hour. You're to come home at once.
I can't come home now mum, we're learning how to be soldiers.
Well you'll just have to learn how to be soldiers some other time.
Half the platoon will be in the Novelty Rock Emporium and from Stone's Amusement Arcade we shall be strongly supported by the rest of the platoon, on bicycles.
If anyone approaches you shout 'halt, who goes there' and take down their credentials.
I thought you said I could have the night off, I've got a date.
You've got to do your duty, she can wait.
I know that she can wait but I can't.
Well men, I've got some good news for you.
Oh, you mean our rifles have come.
No, but the ammunition has.
[the platoon are marching back from the camp when an air raid siren is heard, quickly followed by the sound of gunfire and aircraft engines]
Blimey, that was quick! I can hear a plane already!
Who do you think you are?
We're the Local Defense Volunteers, and I'm their appointed commander, Captain Mainwaring, and I must ask you to keep your hands off my privates!
[Mainwaring and Wilson have just left Godfrey watching the Channel]
It's a beautiful sunset, sir.
It's a beautiful land, Wilson. They're not going to get it, you know. We shall fight them until we have just one round each, and we'll use that on ourselves!
[pause]
By the way, how much ammunition have we got?

[trying not to laugh]
One round each, sir!

[when the improvised weapon made of bathtub fell into the water with Walker inside and begun to sink]
Quick Walker - put the plug in!

[Realises that Mainwaring is in charge of the platoon]
Good heavens - it's that damm bank clerk!
